documentType: FBI Collected Item Log / Search Warrant Inventory
summary: This is an FBI Collected Item Log documenting evidence seized during the execution of a search warrant at Jeffrey Epstein's New York City residence on July 6-7, 2019. The inventory lists numerous items including sexually explicit materials, photographs, a massage table, restraints, and financial records, collected as part of the child sex trafficking investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the search warrant and investigation for child sex trafficking. Items seized from his residence are listed.

persons.name: Marc A. Fernich
persons.context: Attorney from whom items were collected, as indicated on the receipt log. His law firm address is listed as the collection point.

persons.name: Barbara Moses
persons.context: The Honorable Judge before whom an amended search warrant rider was sworn, authorizing additional search measures.

persons.name: Steven D. Small
persons.context: Name appears on a 2-page handwritten letter that was seized as evidence from the residence.

connections.description: Fernich's law firm is listed as the location from which items were collected, suggesting a legal representation relationship.
A handwritten letter from Small was found in Epstein's residence, indicating some form of correspondence or connection.

events.title: Search Warrant Execution - Initial
events.description: A search warrant was executed at Jeffrey Epstein's New York City residence at approximately 6:15 PM.

events.title: Search Warrant Execution - Amended
events.description: An amended search warrant rider, sworn before Judge Barbara Moses, authorized additional search measures executed at approximately 2:05 AM.

events.title: Evidence Log Created
events.description: The FBI Collected Item Log was created, documenting all items seized during the search.

locations: 810 7th Avenue Suite 620, New York, New York 10019
keyFacts: A search warrant for child sex trafficking was executed at Jeffrey Epstein's New York City residence on July 6-7, 2019.

Seized evidence included a green massage table, copper handcuffs and a whip, multiple sex toys, photographs of naked females and young girls, and frames of naked females on the walls of a massage room.
Photographic evidence included images of Epstein with two females, and other photos depicting females/girls.
Financial or administrative records were seized, including a handwritten note on Epstein letterhead, a typed letter, and documents listing cash disbursements.
The search was extensive, covering multiple rooms (labeled A, F, O, P, Q, V, GG, 2) and resulting in at least 23 collected item receipts.
